byline.contributor: Julfikar Ali Manik reported from Dhaka, and Nida Najar from New Delhi.
byline.original: By JULFIKAR ALI MANIK and NIDA NAJAR

abstract: Formal murder charges are filed against 41 people for their involvement in 2013 collapse of clothing factory building in Bangladesh; accused include building owner Sohel Rana, owners of several factories in building and multiple government officials who could all face death penalty if convicted.
lead_paragraph: More than 1,100 people were killed in the 2013 collapse of the building, which housed several clothing factories, in what is the garment industry’s worst disaster.

headline.main: Bangladesh Police Charge 41 With Murder Over Rana Plaza Collapse
headline.print_headline: Bangladesh Charges 41 in Collapse of Factory

snippet: More than 1,100 people were killed in the 2013 collapse of the building, which housed several clothing factories, in what is the garment industry’s worst disaster.
